intro: Commelina zanonia, commonly known as the Zanonia spiderwort, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the Commelinaceae family, which includes many species with showy blue or violet flowers. The plant features slender, upright stems and lance-shaped leaves with a slightly hairy texture. Its flowers are typically small, clustered in umbels, and often have a white or pale blue coloration. Commelina zanonia is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forest floors or along stream banks.
